page.title: 12GULVAL CHURCHTOWN
page.content:
Gulval has a{Parish Church,}so the part of the village near the church is called{Churchtown.}It is named after {St.Gudwal}who first brought Christianity to the area. Parts of the Church were built in Norman times. The stonework is granite with stained glass windows. The lychgate leads into the original churchyard which encloses the church. Burials take place in the larger churchyard across the road.
Some of the houses surrounding the church were built about 100 years ago by the Bolitho family, who owned much of the land in the area. The former blacksmith's forge has been a private house for 80 years.{Landicla {Manor}is recorded in the original Domesday Book, and a modern house on the site still has the same name.
